intro: Xylopia longicuspis, commonly known as the long-fruited xylopia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its rough, aromatic bark and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody, elongated fruits containing several seeds. Xylopia longicuspis is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
